intro: Belonophora glomerata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant produces small, ovate leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Belonophora glomerata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It is also known for its ability to produce a profuse bloom during the warmer months.
